channel.title: The 3:59
channel.itunes:author: CNET.com
channel.description: CNET reporters Roger Cheng and Ben Fox Rubin tackle the top tech stories of the day. Don't mind their awkwardness.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Tech news, fast. Really
channel.itunes:summary: CNET reporters Roger Cheng and Ben Fox Rubin tackle the top tech stories of the day. Don't mind their awkwardness.

item.title: Are Android smartphones as safe as iPhones? (The 3:59, Ep. 370)
item.author: feedback-cnettv@cnet.com (CNETTV)
item.description: Google beefs up its security for smartphones, the US levels sanctions against Russia, and the internet of things still scares us.
item.itunes:subtitle: Google beefs up its security for smartphones, the US levels sanctions against Russia, and the internet of things still scares us.
item.itunes:summary: Google beefs up its security for smartphones, the US levels sanctions against Russia, and the internet of things still scares us.

item.title: Amazon's Alexa could become the Venmo of voice (The 3:59, Ep. 369)
item.author: feedback-cnettv@cnet.com (CNETTV)
item.description: We discuss sending cash via Alexa, more Equifax drama, and a wonder material that can charge your phone in 7 seconds.
item.itunes:subtitle: We discuss sending cash via Alexa, more Equifax drama, and a wonder material that can charge your phone in 7 seconds.
item.itunes:summary: We discuss sending cash via Alexa, more Equifax drama, and a wonder material that can charge your phone in 7 seconds.

item.title: Can VR help reduce hospital patients' pain? (The 3:59, Ep. 368)
item.author: feedback-cnettv@cnet.com (CNETTV)
item.description: On today's podcast, we chat about hospitals' use of VR, Trump's involvement in Broadcom and Qualcomm, and AMD security flaws.
item.itunes:subtitle: On today's podcast, we chat about hospitals' use of VR, Trump's involvement in Broadcom and Qualcomm, and AMD security flaws.
item.itunes:summary: On today's podcast, we chat about hospitals' use of VR, Trump's involvement in Broadcom and Qualcomm, and AMD security flaws.

item.title: Elon Musk wants to build great bars on Mars (The 3:59, Ep. 367)
item.author: feedback-cnettv@cnet.com (CNETTV)
item.description: The SpaceX CEO tells a SXSW crowd he wants to save humanity with a Martian beer, plus ransomware on robots and a "Ready Player One" review.
item.itunes:subtitle: The SpaceX CEO tells a SXSW crowd he wants to save humanity with a Martian beer, plus ransomware on robots and a "Ready Player One" review.

item.title: Samsung's Galaxy S9: Here's what we REALLY think (The 3:59, Ep. 366)

item.description: We break down everything about Samsung's latest flagship smartphone. Is the camera really that great?

item.title: Your quote tweets are ruining the internet (The 3:59, Ep. 365)
item.author: feedback-cnettv@cnet.com (CNETTV)
item.description: How do you call out a bad tweet? We discuss that, flying cars and Microsoft's Surface Pro with LTE.
